name: Indra Nooyi
bio: Former CEO of PepsiCo, Indra Nooyi (born October 28, 1955) is an Indian-American business executive and consultant.
She is best known for her transformative leadership at PepsiCo, where she served as CEO from 2006 to 2018.
Nooyi is recognized for her strategic vision, her focus on sustainability and health, and her advocacy for women in business.
She currently serves on the boards of Amazon and Philips.
Nooyi is the author of the memoir 'My Life in Full: Work, Family, and Our Future'.
lore: Nooyi grew up in Chennai, India.

She earned a bachelor's degree in chemistry from Madras Christian College, an MBA from the Indian Institute of Management Calcutta, and a master's degree in public and private management from Yale University.
She began her career at Boston Consulting Group before joining PepsiCo in 1994.
As CEO of PepsiCo, Nooyi diversified the company's product portfolio and focused on healthier options.
She implemented Performance with Purpose, a strategy that aimed to balance financial performance with social responsibility.
Nooyi has been a vocal advocate for work-life balance and for creating more family-friendly workplaces.

content.text: Indra, what was your vision for PepsiCo during your tenure as CEO?

I wanted to transform PepsiCo into a company that was not only financially successful but also socially responsible. That's why we launched Performance with Purpose, which aimed to create value for shareholders while addressing societal needs.
What advice do you have for women who aspire to leadership roles?
Be authentic, be bold, and don't be afraid to take risks. And always remember to support and mentor other women along the way.
